title: KYC identity verification documents
dataVerified: Customer name, date of birth, address, ID numbers, nationality, PEP (Politically Exposed Person) status
dataVisibleAfterVerification: Shows the issuer domain and the responder text (e.g., "Valid ID" or "Denied").
rationale: Prevents fake identity documents for account opening. Domain binding verifies document issuer (government, notary). Bank scans government ID and verifies cryptographically. Tamper-evident verification. Regulatory compliance (Bank Secrecy Act, Customer Due Diligence rules). Privacy-preserving without cloud upload of sensitive documents. Critical for AML/KYC where identity fraud enables money laundering.
